humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states 'Sections of the axillary dissection demonstrate metastatic carcinoma in 2 of 14 lymph nodes' which indicates that the patient has metastases in 2 axillary lymph nodes and no metastases in other specified locations (in-transit, satellite, or micrometastases, or in ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases). This corresponds to the N1 stage as per the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that there are metastatic carcinoma deposits in 2 out of 14 lymph nodes (2/14) with the largest metastasis measuring 3.4 cm and extracapsular extension present. This corresponds to a pathologic N stage of N1.
